items.title: PepsiCo cuts earnings forecast as it predicts 'uncertainty' in tariffs, consumer spending
items.content: PepsiCo cut its forecast for its core constant currency earnings per share, citing new tariffs.
items.contentSnippet: PepsiCo cut its forecast for its core constant currency earnings per share, citing new tariffs.

items.title: Tide owner Procter & Gamble cuts earnings, revenue outlook as quarterly sales disappoint
items.content: Procter & Gamble's quarterly earnings topped estimates, but its revenue fell short of expectations.
items.contentSnippet: Procter & Gamble's quarterly earnings topped estimates, but its revenue fell short of expectations.

items.title: Bristol Myers Squibb tops quarterly estimates, hikes outlook as drugmaker braces for tariffs
items.content: The guidance revisions include the estimated impact of current tariffs on U.S. products shipped to China, but not Trump's planned pharmaceutical tariffs.
items.contentSnippet: The guidance revisions include the estimated impact of current tariffs on U.S. products shipped to China, but not Trump's planned pharmaceutical tariffs.

items.title: Comcast beats first-quarter earnings estimates despite losing broadband customers
items.content: Comcast lost 199,000 total domestic broadband customers, reflecting the continued pressure on the cable giant's cornerstone business.
items.contentSnippet: Comcast lost 199,000 total domestic broadband customers, reflecting the continued pressure on the cable giant's cornerstone business.

items.title: Merck lowers profit outlook, partly due to $200 million expected tariff hit
items.content: Merck said the expected tariff charge primarily reflects levies between the U.S. and China, but does not account for Trump's planned pharmaceutical tariffs.
items.contentSnippet: Merck said the expected tariff charge primarily reflects levies between the U.S. and China, but does not account for Trump's planned pharmaceutical tariffs.

items.title: Trump considering exemption for automakers on some tariffs, White House says
items.content: Trump is considering exemptions for automakers from some tariffs announced by his administration, the White House confirmed Wednesday.
items.contentSnippet: Trump is considering exemptions for automakers from some tariffs announced by his administration, the White House confirmed Wednesday.

items.title: Southwest to cut flights this year, pulls guidance, citing 'macroeconomic uncertainty'
items.content: Southwest Airlines said it plans to cut flights in the second half of 2025 and pulled its 2025 and 2026 guidance.
items.contentSnippet: Southwest Airlines said it plans to cut flights in the second half of 2025 and pulled its 2025 and 2026 guidance.

items.title: Chipotle is seeing a 'slowdown' in consumer spending as 2025 gets off to a rough start
items.content: Chipotle's same-store sales fell in the first quarter for the first time since 2020.
items.contentSnippet: Chipotle's same-store sales fell in the first quarter for the first time since 2020.

items.title: Alaska Airlines warns of slower demand as second-quarter profit outlook falls short
items.content: Alaska Airlines warned of weaker demand, pressuring airfares.
items.contentSnippet: Alaska Airlines warned of weaker demand, pressuring airfares.

items.title: Corporate America shelled out millions for Trump's inauguration. Now he's upending many of their businesses
items.content: Corporations like Target, McDonald's and Delta donated to Trump's inaugural committee after skipping the last two cycles. Now he has roiled their businesses.
items.contentSnippet: Corporations like Target, McDonald's and Delta donated to Trump's inaugural committee after skipping the last two cycles. Now he has roiled their businesses.

items.title: Trump wants automakers to move vehicle production to the U.S. It's not that simple
items.content: Relocating production lines takes years of planning and construction and requires massive amounts of space and capital.
items.contentSnippet: Relocating production lines takes years of planning and construction and requires massive amounts of space and capital.

items.title: International tourism to the U.S. slumps, but Americans can't stop traveling overseas
items.content: United Airlines and Delta Air Lines say international and premium travel is robust while domestic coach-class travel and some corporate travel has slowed.
items.contentSnippet: United Airlines and Delta Air Lines say international and premium travel is robust while domestic coach-class travel and some corporate travel has slowed.

items.title: Ford launches exclusive experience program for its priciest pickups
items.content: Ford is offering its most premium pickup truck customers a new package, including a personal concierge, accessory discounts and a maintenance plan.
items.contentSnippet: Ford is offering its most premium pickup truck customers a new package, including a personal concierge, accessory discounts and a maintenance plan.

items.title: Why cable companies like Comcast and Charter are leaning into mobile service
items.content: Less than a decade after cable giants like Comcast and Charter jumped into the mobile business, the segment has become a significant financial driver.
items.contentSnippet: Less than a decade after cable giants like Comcast and Charter jumped into the mobile business, the segment has become a significant financial driver.

items.title: Boeing CEO says China has stopped taking its aircraft amid trade war
items.content: CEO Kelly Ortberg said that a few 737 Max planes that were in China set to be delivered to carriers there have been flown back to the U.S.
items.contentSnippet: CEO Kelly Ortberg said that a few 737 Max planes that were in China set to be delivered to carriers there have been flown back to the U.S.

items.title: Boeing to seek FAA approval this year to increase 737 Max production as losses narrow
items.content: Boeing's first quarter loss narrowed to $31 million in the first quarter and it burned less cash than analysts estimated.
items.contentSnippet: Boeing's first quarter loss narrowed to $31 million in the first quarter and it burned less cash than analysts estimated.

items.title: Asian Americans take bigger share of sports viewership, Nielsen says
items.content: Asian Americans are taking a bigger share of live sports viewership, according to a recent report from Nielsen.
items.contentSnippet: Asian Americans are taking a bigger share of live sports viewership, according to a recent report from Nielsen.

items.title: Eli Lilly sues four telehealth sites selling compounded Zepbound, Mounjaro
items.content: Eli Lilly & Co. is suing four telehealth companies selling compounded versions of Lilly's weight-loss drug Zepbound and its diabetes drug Mounjaro.
items.contentSnippet: Eli Lilly & Co. is suing four telehealth companies selling compounded versions of Lilly's weight-loss drug Zepbound and its diabetes drug Mounjaro.

items.title: FDA to phase out dyes used in Flamin' Hot Cheetos, Skittles and other snacks
items.content: The FDA is phasing out the use of petroleum-based synthetic dyes in food and drinks.
items.contentSnippet: The FDA is phasing out the use of petroleum-based synthetic dyes in food and drinks.

items.title: Auto groups lobby Trump administration against parts tariffs in rare unified message
items.content: The group – representing franchised dealers, suppliers and nearly all major automakers – say the upcoming levies could jeopardize U.S. automotive production.
items.contentSnippet: The group – representing franchised dealers, suppliers and nearly all major automakers – say the upcoming levies could jeopardize U.S. automotive production.

items.title: Warner Bros. Discovery starts Max password-sharing crackdown
items.content: Priced at $7.99 a month, the friend or family member of the primary account owner gets their own stand-alone account under the same subscription.
items.contentSnippet: Priced at $7.99 a month, the friend or family member of the primary account owner gets their own stand-alone account under the same subscription.

items.title: RTX, GE Aerospace expect more than $1 billion tariff impact
items.content: Aerospace suppliers are grappling with higher prices for parts from President Donald Trump's tariffs.
items.contentSnippet: Aerospace suppliers are grappling with higher prices for parts from President Donald Trump's tariffs.

items.title: NYC's most expensive home lists for $110 million amid market uncertainty
items.content: The four-floor listing at 111 West 57th St. spans 11,480 square feet and is being pitched as a rare collector’s item for global elites.
items.contentSnippet: The four-floor listing at 111 West 57th St. spans 11,480 square feet and is being pitched as a rare collector’s item for global elites.

items.title: Inside the $1 billion berry startup backed by Ray Dalio’s family office

items.title: Tennis great Andre Agassi to play his first pro pickleball tournament with No. 1 player Waters

items.title: Chipotle to expand to Mexico amid Trump trade war with U.S. neighbor

items.title: More rich Americans are opening Swiss bank accounts fearing U.S. risks
items.content: Swiss banks say they have seen a surge of interest and business from high-net-worth Americans opening investment accounts in recent months.
items.contentSnippet: Swiss banks say they have seen a surge of interest and business from high-net-worth Americans opening investment accounts in recent months.

items.title: Canadian small businesses are taking Trump's tariffs personally
items.content: Canadian national pride has sparked resistance and inspired action from small businesses.
items.contentSnippet: Canadian national pride has sparked resistance and inspired action from small businesses.

items.title: Netflix posts major earnings beat as revenue grows 13% in first quarter
items.content: The report marks the first time Netflix did not disclose quarterly subscriber data, as it shifts its strategy to focus on revenue and other metrics.

items.title: Netflix maintained its 2025 guidance. That may not be the sign of confidence it seems
items.content: Netflix's choice not to bump guidance suggests caution despite the company predicting limited effect from macroeconomic turbulence.
